text: Please make time in your #ICA21 schedule to "attend" the CAT business meeting. 47 minutes of fun, including awards! Find us by clicking on the division, then searching business. https://t.co/rtXQ4hMIQw

I'm very proud of this work and thankful for such wonderful collaborators. @ShelbyWilcox, @GongXuanjun, @ulusoyez, @robynbriaadams, @cj_jmnz, @yoojungerikaoh, @QiankunZhong, @berilbulat, @justinkeene, @allison_eden, thank YOU for your hard work and excellent contributions #ICA21

The theoretical papers work to integrate vast literatures that have largely talked past each other. Both of these papers are student-lead (great job @berilbulat and @yoojungerikaoh!!!) and are very ambitious in scope and rigorous in their approach #ICA21

The empirical studies use state-of-the-art network science techniques (multilayer community detection, instantaneous phase synchronization), psychophysiology, and computational modeling (fitting both empirical and simulated data!!) to test core communication processes #ICA21

text: Last, but certainly not least, @QiankunZhong uses costless signaling theory to formally model circumstances when, in both single and repeated interaction, people are likely to share honest information #ICA21 https://t.co/2un647bBq2 https://t.co/n5qWjnyWLG

.@yoojungerikaoh's presentation places information theory on a biological foundation. In doing so, she provides a path forward for researchers looking to test one of our field's oldest theories #ICA21 https://t.co/WFjg7Bgwn5

In a similar approach, @justinkeene and colleagues present a psychophysiological investigation into flow. The results illuminate the physiological dynamics underpinning flow experiences #ICA21 https://t.co/TV44H1HECJ https://t.co/LF3soxXmtX

Our Top Paper is a collaboration with @justinkeene, @ShelbyWilcox, @GongXuanjun, @robynbriaadams, and @cj_jmnz. Two studies use behavioral and dynamic brain-network analysis to test core predictions drawn from the Synchronization Theory of Flow #ICA21 https://t.co/8R0WSsLx5q https://t.co/kqpyn1NHkU

Next, @GongXuanjun presents results from two studies using a multi-attribute computational model (the drift diffusion model) to formalize key predictions drawn from Mood Management Theory. Big thanks to @ulusoyez and @allison_eden! #ICA21 https://t.co/7ErVlWrylp https://t.co/KlNltMn3UV

Up first, @berilbulat reviews the biological basis of political ideology and offers suggestions for researchers interested in examining biological processes in political communication #ICA21 https://t.co/3hgh9gMuPY https://t.co/j3fESNfIg6
